candidates.name: Albie Barr
candidates.why_stand: I stand to make a positive change for a community that I love. Drive, passion, analytical skills and ideas are invaluable qualities gained after years negotiating with political leaders, business executives, achieving great success. Primary being a councillor is a governance and advocacy role, I have a proven track record.

candidates.name: Steve Capper
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Whangarei for all but 2 years of my life, so have a deep understanding of our issues. My experience as a business owner and a senior manager will translate into well researched decision making. My community focused style will create a more inclusive council.
candidates.why_stand: Whangarei has great green spaces, culture, and a unique natural environment. I wish to preserve these while also strategically developing our industry to improve living for all our people. Catering for our growing and aging population is a must and we have to plan for this now.

candidates.name: Vince Cocurullo
candidates.why_elect: Being a successful local business person, I believe in open and transparent communication. Making sure the client pays only what they need to pay. I am accessible and approachable, and I understand governance and leading by example.
candidates.why_stand: I believe in our district, and want our district to grow responsibly. Being a local business person for the past 20 years, I want to make council more proactive not reactive to our clients needs, which means taking ownership when it has done something wrong.

candidates.name: Nicholas Hunter Connop
candidates.why_elect: I have worked with you and served you for most of my life. I am a positive person and always try to find the best opportunity to have a win win situation. Always willing to listen to you and hear what you need to say.
candidates.why_stand: I love our home. I believe we have a lot to offer, many hidden gems waiting to be revealed so that they can be discovered. I believe if we find a way to work together we will shine and create town that is a destination that is full of experience.

candidates.name: Tony Gill
candidates.why_elect: I live for over 17 years in Whangarei and has always been involved many groups and represented others. Been on NGO health board, Helped to improve the Whangarei Public Dog Park. Just trained as a first responder (medic) I'm on the WDC Civil Defence team. I am environmentally aware.
candidates.why_stand: I will work for you because I don't have any ties from others, I'm a very community person where I have the passion to make a better place for you and the future. I wouldn't run if I didn't think I have the ability to make our place better.

candidates.name: Melanie Payne
candidates.why_elect: Though I am proud to stand as a Transwoman I also have a lifetime of worldwide travel, work and skills. I can add value to Council with my wide range of management and governance experience alongside my lifelong passions for Civil and Human Rights, Peace and Security for all.
candidates.why_stand: I see the urgent need for more diverse representation than current Council. This quote from WDC "Stand"campaign. [Council news 12/7/19] "While we have a diverse community in Northland, all ages, cultures, outlooks and perspectives, we don't always see that diversity represented in our Councils."  I rest my case!

candidates.name: Carol Peters
candidates.why_elect: As a candidate, I bring wide experience in community development, housing, welfare, and more. I have a passion to ensure there is enough housing for everyone—elderly, young families, people without a warm place to live. To ensure Whangārei is prepared for climate damage. To make central Whangārei welcoming to all.
candidates.why_stand: On council, I can contribute to building inclusive communities. I will work towards more respectful council relationships with marae and hapu. I want a city friendly to children, elderly; a renewed inner city fostering small business and community enterprises working together. I see us being better prepared for climate change.
